channel.title: Get a 9.9 on vista rating!
channel.description:
Get a 9.9 on vista rating! Heres a hack I figured out back when Vista first came out. (My pc was a 3.0 on the rater.) First, run the rater on your computer. Now write down the scores that you get. EG: Cpu - 4.2 Ram - 4.5 Graphics - 4.5 Gaming - 3.0 Hard Disk - 5.3 The decimal values are crucial.
Now, go to %windir%\Performance\WinSAT\DataStore\ and open the bottom file in NOTEPAD. now click CTRL+H and in the first box, type your cpu score in quotes EG: "4.2" in the second box type "9.9" with the quotes. click 'Replace All' now do the same with all your other scores (change the first box to your score.) And if you have more than one score the same, it doesnt matter.
Now, save the file to your desktop. Pull the file into %windir%\Performance\WinSAT\DataStore\ and reopen system properties, you now have a 9.9pc, you can run any game you want without vista telling you that your pc isnt a good enough score.

item.description:
@wow_raped_XD wrote:

Vista lags way to much, I bought a used dell xp (yup, dell :() and my computer is twice as fast as my $1,200 laptop that had 2.0 gigs of ram…and the latest processer(< spelled wrong =/). Basically, vista sucks, XP or Ubuntu rocks.

wait, vista wont let you try playing a game if vista doesn’t think you pc can take it?

Thats balls :S; battlefield 2 tells me i need to upgrade my graphics card to play battlefield 2 yet i can still play it on lowest settings with not much lag.

Actually no, he’s wrong. Any game will play regardless of your rating.
[/quote]

Well when I tried to install halo 2 (3.0 rating) on less than a 3.0 rating pc it said that your pc does not have the required rating.[/quote]
Lies. I installed it on my old laptop that was a 2.0 and it worked fine.
